subject: Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: The former major league pitcher Rick Rhoden had a hole-in-one yesterday to take a two-stroke lead after the second round of the Champions Tour’s national qualifying tournament. Rhoden, the winner of 50 celebrity golf titles, aced the 186-yard 17th hole with a five-iron and finished with a two-under-par 70 for a six-under 138 total at TPC Eagle Trace in Coral Springs, Fla. It was his ninth career hole-in-one and fourth in competition. He also made one at the 2006 United States Senior Open.
